title: Create a Description List
ques: How do you create a description list in HTML?
explanation:
A ***description list*** is created using the ```<dl>``` tag.

- The ***term*** is wrapped in ```<dt>``` (Definition Term).
- The ***description*** of the term is wrapped in ```<dd>``` (Definition Description).
- Each term-description pair is part of the ***description list***, enclosed within ```<dl>``` and ```</dl>```.

title: Ordered List with Different Types
ques: How do you change the numbering style of an ordered list in HTML?
explanation:
The ```type``` attribute of ***ordered lists*** can be used to change the numbering style.

- ```<ol type="A">``` creates a list with ***uppercase letters (A, B, C, ...)***.
- Other possible values include:
  - ```1``` (default) for ***numbers***.
  - ```a``` for ***lowercase letters (a, b, c, ...)***.
  - ```I``` for ***uppercase Roman numerals (I, II, III, ...)***.
  - ```i``` for ***lowercase Roman numerals (i, ii, iii, ...)***.

title: Nested Lists
ques: How do you create a nested list inside an ordered list?
explanation:
A ***nested list*** is created by placing an unordered list ```<ul>``` inside an ordered list ```<ol>```.

- Each ***main list item*** (```<li>```) can contain a ***sub-list***.
- The unordered list (```<ul>```) is nested inside an ordered list (```<ol>```), allowing for ***hierarchical structuring*** of content.

title: Ordered List with Start Attribute
ques: How do you start an ordered list from a specific number instead of 1?
explanation:
The ***start*** attribute is used in ```<ol>``` to specify the ***starting number*** for the list.

- ```start="5"``` makes the first item numbered ***5*** instead of the default ***1***.
- The numbering continues sequentially (**5, 6, 7, ...**).

title: Reversed Ordered List
ques: How do you display an ordered list in reverse order?
explanation:
The ***reversed*** attribute in ```<ol>``` displays the list in ***descending order***.

- Adding ```reversed``` reverses the numbering.
- The first item in the list gets the highest number (**3, 2, 1** in this example).

title: Custom Bullet Points in Unordered List
ques: How can you use CSS to change the bullet style of an unordered list?
explanation:
The ***list-style-type*** property in CSS allows customizing the bullet points.

- ```list-style-type: square;``` changes the default **disc (•)** to ***square (■)***.
- Other possible values include:
  - ```disc``` (default round bullet)
  - ```circle``` (hollow circle bullet)
  - ```none``` (removes bullets completely).

title: Inline List Display
ques: How can you display a list horizontally instead of vertically?
explanation:
By using ***CSS Flexbox***, we can display a list ***horizontally*** instead of vertically.

- ```list-style-type: none;``` removes the bullet points.
- ```display: flex;``` makes the list items appear ***inline***.
- ```gap: 10px;``` adds spacing between list items.

title: Nested Description List
ques: How do you create a nested description list in HTML?
explanation:
A ***nested description list*** is created by placing another ```<dl>``` inside a ```<dd>```.

- The ***main term*** (e.g., ***Frontend***) is wrapped in ```<dt>```.
- The ***sub-list*** (HTML & CSS) is wrapped in another ```<dl>``` inside the ***description*** ```<dd>```.
- This structure is useful for ***grouping related terms*** within a ***hierarchical description list***.

title: Using Images as List Markers
ques: How can you replace bullet points in an unordered list with images?

explanation:
Instead of default bullets, we can use ***custom images*** as list markers with CSS.

- ```list-style: none;``` removes the default bullet points.
- ```background: url('icon.png') no-repeat left center;``` sets an ***image as a custom bullet***.
- ```padding-left: 20px;``` ensures text is properly aligned next to the image.

title: Accessibility with ARIA Attributes in Lists
ques: How do you improve accessibility for a list using ARIA attributes?

explanation:
ARIA attributes help improve ***accessibility*** for screen readers and assistive technologies.

- ```role="list"``` explicitly defines the ***list*** role for better recognition by screen readers.
- ```role="listitem"``` ensures each ***list item*** is correctly interpreted.

title: Multicolumn List Using CSS
ques: How do you display an HTML list in multiple columns?
explanation:
The ***column-count*** property in CSS allows splitting a list into ***multiple columns***.

- ```column-count: 2;``` arranges list items into ***two equal columns***.
- This is useful for ***long lists*** to improve readability and layout.
